intro: Neohouzeaua stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf houzeaua, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes species like eucalyptus and tea tree. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal or damp forest environments. Neohouzeaua stricta is often found in the understorey of native forests and is adapted to thrive in shaded, moist conditions.
